bug.author: cdluminate
bug.description:
Installed the MKL-DNN debian package, and encountered an error when trying to compile an example: <denchmark-code>~/p/m/m/examples ❯❯❯ apt list libmkldnn-dev Listing... Done libmkldnn-dev/now 0.13~20180406-ga5f6077-1 amd64 [installed,local] ~/p/m/m/examples ❯❯❯ g++ simple_net_int8.cpp -lmkldnn ~/p/m/m/examples ❯❯❯ ./a.out status: 5 message: could not create a convolution forward primitive descriptor </denchmark-code>
The other examples are fine.

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cdluminate>@cdluminate</denchmark-link> , What is the hardware? Int8 requires the CPU with avx512-bw support, e.g. Skylake server. For other systems there is a fallback code based on Intel MKL (or Intel MKL-ML binary blob), but if you build Intel MKL-DNN as a standalone library then this fallback is unavailable. We should probably adjust the example to report more meaningful error message in case of hardware incompatibility...

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/emfomenk>@emfomenk</denchmark-link> My CPU is 7440HQ, which has no AVX512-bw as far as I know. The library was built standalone without MKL or MKL-ML,so I guess the fallback is unavailable. So this is a issue about a more meaningful error report.
